subject: Relationships
title: Active Listening: The Rarest Skill
description: A micro-lesson that makes Active Listening: The Rarest Skill usable.

hook.text: Most people don't listen to understand. They listen to respond. That's not listening â€” it's waiting.

buildup.text: Active listening means reflecting back what you heard: 'So you're saying...' before adding your perspective.

discovery.text: Studies show that feeling heard is more important to relationship satisfaction than feeling agreed with.

twist.text: Active listening feels slow and awkward. But it de-escalates 70% of arguments within the first two minutes.

climax.text: Listening is not silence. It's engaged, curious attention that makes the other person feel they exist.

punchline.text: Being heard matters more than being agreed with.

quiz.question: What does active listening involve?
options: Reflecting back what you heard before responding
